content: @Calle Sönne wrote the to_app attribute which takes a lemma named F of shape ∀ .., η = θ for a pair of 2-cells in Cat and adds a lemmaF_app : ∀ ... (X : Cat), η.app X = θ.app X. But sometimes we want the reassoc version of this lemma as well. This seems to not be generated when we just provide both attributes @[reassoc, to_app]. Is this intentional, or should we change to_app to generate the extra lemma?
I think if you do @[to_app (attr := reassoc)] you get the reassoc version of both the original lemma and the to_app lemma.
and if i write simp inside do all 4 lemmas get simp?

Kyle Miller said:

I think if you do @[to_app (attr := reassoc)] you get the reassoc version of both the original lemma and the to_app lemma.

Oh that works! Thank you. Next question: should this be changed in, say, CategoryTheory.Pseudofunctor.mapComp_assoc_right_hom?
@Kenny Lau I'm not sure if it's @[to_app (attr := reassoc (attr := simp))] or @[to_app (attr := simp, reassoc (attr := simp))] or ...
do we need to make an attr attr?

joseph hua said:

joseph hua said:

Calle Sönne wrote the to_app attribute which takes a lemma named F of shape ∀ .., η = θ for a pair of 2-cells in Cat and adds a lemmaF_app : ∀ ... (X : Cat), η.app X = θ.app X. But sometimes we want the reassoc version of this lemma as well. This seems to not be generated when we just provide both attributes @[reassoc, to_app]. Is this intentional, or should we change to_app to generate the extra lemma?

Oh that works! Thank you. Next question: should this be changed in, say, CategoryTheory.Pseudofunctor.mapComp_assoc_right_hom?

I didn't think much about this when putting the @[to_app] there, I was not sure yet how widely this would be used so I didn't want to overcomplicate it (and I only needed it without _reassoc at that point). So if you want to add reassoc there then go ahead!

I also think for now the (potentially double) attr seems fine, but maybe later I should think about some better notation for this, especially if more attributes that can be combined with to_app are added.
I'm also sure there are many places in the library that should have to_app but don't, but again I didn't want to put it everywhere when I made it since I didn't know if it would be used or not.
